snippet: Fifteen members of a group called Respect the Flag are accused of violating Georgia’s anti-street-gang ordinance during a confrontation in July.
abstract: Fifteen members of Confederate heritage group Respect the Flag are indicted on charges of violating Georgia’s anti-street-gang ordinance, called Gang Terrorism and Prevention Act; prosecutors say members of group hurled racist threats at group of black people attending an outdoor birthday party in suburb of Atlanta, waving Confederate battle flag and displaying weapons; unusual legal maneuver charges all 15 members of Respect the Flag with making terroristic threats and criminal gang activity.
lead_paragraph: Fifteen members of a group called Respect the Flag are accused of violating Georgia’s anti-street-gang ordinance during a confrontation in July.

headline.main: Confrontation With Black Partygoers Leads to Gang Charges for White Group
headline.print_headline: Confrontation With Black Partygoers Leads to Gang Charges for White Group
